TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract HttpWorkerRequest extends System.Object

Docs.summary: This abstract class defines the base worker methods and enumerations used by ASP.NET managed code to process requests.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In most cases, your code will not deal with HttpWorkerRequest directly because request and response data are exposed through the <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest> and <xref:System.Web.HttpResponse> classes. Some internal ASP.NET classes extend this class. If your code implements its own hosting environment, it will need to extend this class to call the <xref:System.Web.HttpRuntime.ProcessRequest%2A> method. In addition, your code could create a derived class for the purpose of child-request execution within a given application in order to pass its instance to <xref:System.Web.HttpRuntime.ProcessRequest%2A>. In this case, the derived class should keep a reference to the current HttpWorkerRequest and delegate most of the methods to it.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The HttpWorkerRequest constructor is the default constructor for the <xref:System.Web.HttpWorkerRequest> class.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual IAsyncResult BeginFlush (AsyncCallback callback, object state);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.IAsyncResult BeginFlush(class System.AsyncCallback callback, object state) cil managed

Docs.param: The method to call when a corresponding asynchronous operation completes.
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous flush operation from other requests.
Docs.summary: Sends the currently buffered response to the client.
Docs.returns: The worker request buffers the status, headers, and response body until an asynchronous flush operation is initiated. If the underlying object supports asynchronous flush and this method is called from an asynchronous module event or asynchronous handler, the send operation is performed asynchronously. Otherwise, the implementation performs a synchronous flush operation.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual IAsyncResult BeginRead (byte[] buffer, int offset, int count, AsyncCallback callback, object state);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.IAsyncResult BeginRead(unsigned int8[] buffer, int32 offset, int32 count, class System.AsyncCallback callback, object state) cil managed

Docs.param: The buffer to read the data into.
The byte offset in the buffer at which to begin writing data.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
The method to call when a corresponding asynchronous operation completes.
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous read from other requests.
Docs.summary: Begins an asynchronous read operation of the request entity body.
Docs.returns: Begins an asynchronous read operation of the request entity body.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CloseConnection() cil managed

Docs.summary: Terminates the connection with the client.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void EndFlush(class System.IAsyncResult asyncResult) cil managed

Docs.param: A reference to the pending asynchronous request.
Docs.summary: Waits for the pending asynchronous flush operation to complete.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void EndOfRequest() cil managed

Docs.summary: Used by the runtime to notify the that request processing for the current request is complete.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 EndRead(class System.IAsyncResult asyncResult) cil managed

Docs.param: A reference to the pending asynchronous request.
Docs.summary: Waits for the pending asynchronous read operation to complete.
Docs.returns: The number of bytes that have been read from the stream.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void FlushResponse(bool finalFlush) cil managed

Docs.param: if this is the last time response data will be flushed; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Sends all pending response data to the client.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetAppPath() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the virtual path to the currently executing server application.
Docs.returns: The virtual path of the current application.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetAppPathTranslated() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the physical path to the currently executing server application.
Docs.returns: The physical path of the current application.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetAppPoolID() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns the application pool ID for the current URL.
Docs.returns: Always returns null.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int64 GetBytesRead() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the number of bytes read in from the client.
Docs.returns: A containing the number of bytes read.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance unsigned int8[] GetClientCertificate() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the certification fields (specified in the X.509 standard) from a request issued by the client.
Docs.returns: A byte array containing the stream of the entire certificate content.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If no certificate is sent, the <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest.ClientCertificate%2A> collection returns empty.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance unsigned int8[] GetClientCertificateBinaryIssuer() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the certificate issuer, in binary format.
Docs.returns: A byte array containing the certificate issuer expressed in binary format.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 GetClientCertificateEncoding() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns the <xref:System.Text.Encoding> object in which the client certificate was encoded.
Docs.returns: The certificate encoding, expressed as an integer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance unsigned int8[] GetClientCertificatePublicKey() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a object associated with the client certificate.
Docs.returns: A object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype System.DateTime GetClientCertificateValidFrom() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the date when the certificate becomes valid. The date varies with international settings.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.DateTime> object representing when the certificate becomes valid.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype System.DateTime GetClientCertificateValidUntil() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the certificate expiration date.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.DateTime> object representing the date that the certificate expires.

Docs.summary: Specifies the index number for the HTTP header.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int ReadEntityBody (byte[] buffer, int size);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 ReadEntityBody(unsigned int8[] buffer, int32 size) cil managed

Docs.param: The byte array to read data into.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
Docs.summary: Reads request data from the client (when not preloaded).
Docs.returns: The number of bytes read.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An implementation is free to return fewer bytes than requested even if the end of the stream has not been reached.
Use this overload to specify the response for message bodies greater than 2 GB.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int ReadEntityBody (byte[] buffer, int offset, int size);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int32 ReadEntityBody(unsigned int8[] buffer, int32 offset, int32 size) cil managed

Docs.param: The byte array to read data into.
The byte offset at which to begin reading.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
Docs.summary: Reads request data from the client (when not preloaded) by using the specified buffer to read from, byte offset, and maximum bytes.
Docs.returns: The number of bytes read.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An implementation is free to return fewer bytes than requested even if the end of the stream has not been reached.
Use this overload to specify the response for message bodies greater than 2 GB.

Docs.summary: Specifies a reason for the request.
Specifies a reason for the request.
Specifies a reason for the request.
Specifies a reason for the request. The default value is .
Specifies a reason for the request.
Specifies a reason for the request.
Specifies the index number for the HTTP request header.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework assigns an index number to each standard HTTP header type, for use in the <xref:System.Web.HttpWorkerRequest.GetKnownRequestHeader%2A> and <xref:System.Web.HttpWorkerRequest.SendKnownResponseHeader%2A> methods.

Docs.summary: Gets the corresponding Event Tracking for Windows trace ID for the current request.
Docs.value: A trace ID for the current ASP.NET request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ASP.NET requests execute with the same trace ID as the corresponding IIS request. This facilitates tracking a request throughout its lifetime, starting with the HTTP.SYS kernel-mode HTTP listener, through the IIS service, and into the ASP.NET system. The IDs provided by IIS differ based on the platform and service pack level.

Docs.summary: Specifies the index number for the HTTP response header.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework assigns an index number to each standard HTTP header type, for use in the <xref:System.Web.HttpWorkerRequest.GetKnownRequestHeader%2A> and <xref:System.Web.HttpWorkerRequest.SendKnownResponseHeader%2A> methods.

Docs.summary: Gets the full physical path to the root Web.config file.
Docs.value: The physical path to the root Web.config file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If you are implementing your own hosting environment, you may to override this property to return the location of your environment's root configuration file. An example of this is the <xref:System.Web.Hosting.SimpleWorkerRequest> class which provides a simple implementation of the <xref:System.Web.HttpWorkerRequest>. The <xref:System.Web.Hosting.SimpleWorkerRequest.RootWebConfigPath%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of <xref:System.Web.Hosting.SimpleWorkerRequest> class overrides the RootWebConfigPath property of <xref:System.Web.HttpWorkerRequest> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SendCalculatedContentLength(int32 contentLength) cil managed

Docs.param: The length of the response, in bytes.
Docs.summary: Adds a HTTP header to the response for message bodies that are less than or equal to 2 GB.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the content length is not explicitly set, this method enables the <xref:System.Web.HttpWorkerRequest> instance to add a `Content-Length` HTTP header to the response.
Use this overload to set the `Content-Length` header when the length of the response message body is less than or equal to 2 GB.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SendCalculatedContentLength(int64 contentLength) cil managed

Docs.param: The length of the response, in bytes.
Docs.summary: Adds a HTTP header to the response for message bodies that are greater than 2 GB.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the content length is not explicitly set, this method enables the <xref:System.Web.HttpWorkerRequest> instance to add a `Content-Length` HTTP header to the response. The default implementation calls the overload that takes a `contentLength` parameter of type <xref:System.Int32>.
Use this overload to specify the response for message bodies greater than 2 GB.
